chargeHist.descr: Sex Offender Registry - Fail to Satisfy Registration Requirements

result.execSummary:
The defendant John C Denson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Offender-Fail/Provide Information, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(3)(b)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
3:55 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Jon Wilsnack.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Wilsnack and defendant has received a copy of the presentence investigation report with no correction, additions or deletions.  State has received a copy of the presentence investigation report with no correction, additions or deletions.  Sentencing argument by DA.  Sentencing argument by Atty Wilsnack.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

SWD, and places the defendant on probation for a period of 18 months.

CONDITIONS:

Court costs
7 days county jail, with huber and to commence within 60 days
Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.

Court adjourned at 4:03 p.m.
from Atty Jon Wilsnack - requests  the sentencing hearing scheduled on 03/10 be rescheduled
Sentencing hearing at 03-16-2015 03:00 pm
to counsel with copy of presentence investigation report
to Agent Michael Pulice - court grants request for 2 week extension
from Agent Pulice - requests an additional 2 weeks to complete and file the PSI.
Sentencing hearing on March 10, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

10:18 a.m.  State by ADA Lisa Vanden Branden.  Defendant present with Attorney Jon Wilsnack.

Court recites agreement - defendant plea to the charge - both counsel request PSI.  ADA concurs, Attorney Wilsnack concurs, defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - waived.  Court goes over the elements of the offense.  Court instructs regarding the maximum penalties.  Court instructs regarding deportation.  Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.  

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently, and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty and orders a judgment of conviction be entered today.  Court orders a PSI and to be completed within sixty days - Sentencing to be scheduled thereafter.

Court adjourned at 10:23 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 9, 2014 at 10:15 am.

3:05 p.m.  State by DA Andrew Christenson.  Defendant present with Attorney Jon Wilsnack.

Statement by Attorney Wilsnack - requests a two week adjournment to advise if accept offer or not.

Court directs matter be set for internal review to be held in approximately two weeks.

Court adjourned at 3:06 p.m.
Status hearing on October 14, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

2:04 p.m.  State by ADA Lisa Vanden Branden.  Defendant present with Attorney Jon Wilsnack.

Attorney Wilsnack states just received the discovery disk - not ready to enter a plea today.

Court directs Status Hearing to be held in approximately thirty days.

Court adjourned at 2:05 p.m.
State's
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 23, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 16, 2014 at 11:30 am.

1:43 p.m.  State by ADA Lisa Vanden Branden.  Defendant present with Attorney Jon Wilsnack.

Attorney Wilsnack waives the preliminary on behalf of the defendant.  Defendant concurs.

Court instructs defendant of his right to a preliminary hearing - defendant waives this right - court accepts the waiver and binds the defendant over for trial.

ADA files an Information with the court and provides a copy to Attorney Wilsnack.  Attorney Wilsnack confirms receipt of the Information - waives reading - enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.

Court directs Plea/Sentencing to be held in approximately thirty to sixty days.

Court adjourned at 1:45 p.m.
Waiver of Prelim on August 19, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

11:30 a.m.  State by ADA Lisa Vanden Branden.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Jon Wilsnack present on behalf of the defendant.

Attorney Wilsnack requests matter be set for Waiver of Preliminary and Plea/Sentencing within thirty days.  Court will so schedule.

Court adjourned at 11:31 a.m.
Waiver of Prelim on July 22, 2014 at 11:30 am.

1:57 p.m.  State by ADA Lisa Vanden Branden.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Jon Wilsnack present on behalf of the defendant.

Statement by Attorney Wilsnack - requests set for waiver of preliminary hearing.  Court will so schedule.

Court adjourned at 1:57 p.m.
Status hearing on June 17, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant is to comply with any requirements of the Sex Offender Registry.  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.
Defendant is to comply with any requirements of the Sex Offender Registry.  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

10:44 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Jon Wilsnack.  Kyle Sargent for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Wilsnack confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $1,000.00 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to comply with any requirements of the Sex Offender Registry.  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the time limits.  Court will set for Status of prelim in 30 days.

Court adjourned at 10:46 a.m.

Danni from Atty Jon Wilsnack's office called and requested this matter be moved to 10:00 a.m. as Atty Wilsnack will be in Fond du lac.  Matter moved to 10:00 a.m.  Atty Wilsnack to let his client know of the time change.
